school.name: MCT's Rajiv Gandhi Institute Of Technology

projects.title: POI Position and Force Controller Design for Industrial Wire Bonders
projects.description:
1. The different methods of wire bonding used in the industry were studied.
2. A literature study was carried out to find the State-of-the-art in Force/Position Control algorithms.
3. These algorithms were graded and compared based on the output requirements of the wire bonding process.
4. A variety of Disturbance observers were considered to estimate the contact force in the absence of a force sensor.
5. A testing methodology was proposed to simulate, and physically test the best algorithms and consequently compare them in the presence and absence of a Force sensor to obtain the Flat-Top Force Profile for the contact force.

contributors.headline: MSc Mechanical Engineer from TU Delft | Seeking Full-Time Opportunities in Semicon Industry

projects.title: Precision Mechanism Design for the course positioning stage of a Plant Pod extractor
projects.description:
1. Concepts were generated based on different design strategies and the design specifications were identified using which grading was carried out to find the best ones.
2. Detailed design was carried out for the X, Y, and Z-rotation stage of the system. 
3. A counter-inertia mechanism was also designed to balance rotations about the Z-direction.
4. FEM analysis was carried out in COMSOL to determine the feasibility of the design. 
5. The failure methods and operational limits of the system were explored by performing a risk analysis.

projects.title: Actuator and Locking Mechanism for a low Frequency MEMS Energy Harvester
projects.description:
1. A Low-frequency MEMS Energy Harvester was designed using a combination of Chevron-type and hot-and-cold beam thermal actuators.
2. The resonating beam buckling was achieved using Chevron-type thermal actuation due to its considerable force generation abilities.
3. The buckled beam was locked in place to prevent excess heat generation using a Hot-and-Cold beam thermal actuator locking mechanism.
4. The dimensions of the mechanism were calculated analytically and validated using COMSOL simulations.
5. A risk analysis was carried out to determine the different types of failure possibilities and accordingly Safety Factors were added to the calculated dimensions before making mask layouts.
6. Three masks were designed in KLayout for the fabrication of the MEMS device in accordance with the EKL MUMPS process.

projects.title: Design, development and testing of a Compliant Leg Mechanism for a Rescue Spider Robot
projects.description:
1. Literature survey was carried out to determine the best compliant mechanism for a leg of a walking Spider-type robot ie. A straight-line path generator.
2. A six-link Klann mechanism was selected and designed to carry out the required task.
3. The parameters such as lengths and angle of actuation were determined using PRBM analysis.
4. Extensive analysis was carried out in ANSYS to determine the feasibility of the design.
5. The mechanism was then 3d-printed to test and compare the results with the mathematically determined output.
6. Straight-line output was achieved and the prototype mechanism was able to withstand multiple rotations of the prime-mover

projects.title: Linear Guide Motion System Control - A Classical Control Systems Approach
projects.description:
1. The provided motion stage problem was converted to an equivalent Spring-Mass-Damper system which was then mathematically modeled to receive a transfer function.
2. System Identification was carried out on the experimental results to validate the received transfer function.
3. The system was modeled in Simulink and a PID controlled was designed using Loop Shaping in Shapeit to ensure system stability and maximum possible bandwidth.
4. The controller performance was evaluated after obtaining the sensitivity functions for the system.
5. The simulation results were then compared to previously obtained experimental results to infer the accuracy of the dynamic model.

contributors.headline: MSc Mechanical Engineer from TU Delft | Seeking Full-Time Opportunities in Semicon Industry

projects.title: Vibrations of a Hand-Arm System - An Engineering Dynamics Analysis
projects.description:
1. Analyzed the vibration dynamics for a discreet model of an arm performing a power-drilling operation.
2. Formulation of the kinetic and potential energies was utilized to derive Equations of Motion using Lagrange Equations. 
3. The Eigen frequencies, modes, and damping ratios corresponding to the system were calculated.
4. The system response was visualized using MATLAB.

projects.title: Advancement of Two Storey Parking System (Bachelor's Degree Final Project)
projects.description:
1. Developed an improved alternate design for the commercially available two-level stack parking system to facilitate the users would be able to take out each car independently as per convenience.
2. The modeling and stress testing of the design was carried out in Autodesk Fusion 360 and FESTO Fluidsim was employed for the simulation of the electro-pneumatic circuit which powered the motion of the platforms.
3. Incorporated IOT to allow remote access to the user and aid in ease of entry and exit.
4. Presented the research paper in IEEE ( Bombay Section ) sponsored Conference on Technology for Future Cities at Mahatma Education Society's Pillai College of Engineering, Mumbai, October 2021.
